abstract: General Electric, which cut its common stock dividend last year for the first time since the Great Depression, may increase it next year and repurchase stock for the first time since 2008 because of a “snapback” at its GE Capital finance unit, the company’s chief financial officer said Tuesday.
snippet: General Electric, which cut its common stock dividend last year for the first time since the Great Depression, may increase it next year and repurchase stock for the first time since 2008 because of a “snapback” at its GE Capital finance unit, the...
lead_paragraph: General Electric, which cut its common stock dividend last year for the first time since the Great Depression, may increase it next year and repurchase stock for the first time since 2008 because of a “snapback” at its GE Capital finance unit, the company’s chief financial officer, Keith S. Sherin, said Tuesday, according to Bloomberg News.

headline.main: Bolstered by Finance Unit, G.E. May Raise Dividend
